item.title: 每一個明天
item.description: 結伴創將來 多麼的美 你的路 我的途 再也不分己與彼 有浪有風來 不捨不棄 每一明天也贈你

item.title: I'll be returning to my internship team at AWS in New York City.
item.description: Thank you to everyone who helped me, especially my mentor Chen Zhang and my manager John Loui.

item.title: One co-authored paper accepted by VLDB 22.
item.description: Submission and re-submission, glad we made it at the second time.

item.title: Break up.
item.description: Yes. After all these years (quite an impressive chunk of my life) of ups and downs, our relationship came to an end. So Long, Goodbye.

item.title: I'll be joining Amazon Web Services as a Software Development Engineer Intern next summer.
item.description: I’m grateful to those who helped me get there and I’m truly blessed.

item.title: I'm now officially a graduate of The Ohio State University, Class 2021.
item.description: Once a Buckeye, Always a Buckeye. Go Bucks!

item.title: Why do I name myself Lucas?
item.description: Psalms 139:9-10 If I rise on the wings of the dawn, if I settle on the far side of the sea, even there your hand will guide me, your right hand will hold me fast.

item.title: about
item.description: Hello there, I’m Rui (Lucas) Zhu u+9510 u+6731, and you are? I’m a graduate student majoring in Computer Science at Purdue University, and I’ll be rejoining Amazon Web Services as a Software Development Engineer in Spring 2023 after interning at AWS Transit Gateway. I graduated from The Ohio State University with a B.S. degree in Computer Engineering. Previsouly, I was advised by Prof. Yang Wang, studying on database systems performance, our work was accepted by VLDB 22.
